title.narrative: Biodiversity of Domesticated South American Camelids and Natural Resources for Food Security in Juli – Puno

description.narrative: The families in the 14 participating communities live in the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the Puno region of southern Peru. The communities are located in regions with the highest poverty rates in the country, as well as high rates of child malnutrition. With recurring cold spells, this area is characterized by harsh weather conditions for agriculture and raising livestock. As the main economic activities, farming and raising animals are done mainly for subsistence and are characterized by low levels of production and little participation in the market. The project, with support from the Association for Sustainable Development and Agroecology (Asociación Para el Desarrollo Sostenible y Fomento Agroecológico) ADESFA, plans to strengthen the abilities of 640 small farmer families by enhancing the genetic biodiversity of South American camelids (mainly alpacas and llamas), sheep and Andean crops using an agroecology approach. Natural pastures will also be improved, as will the small farmer communities and bonds among communities. The purpose is to help improve the families’ living conditions, with food security and insertion into local and regional markets, creating opportunities for defending the small farmer lifestyle and defense of its food sovereignty.
